title: What would be a title for a thesis that suits in information technology? - Quora
tags: Federation for Children with Special Needs

response.answer_text: List of Thesis Title for IT Student List Of Thesis Title1. Client server based guidance system2. On-line courseware3. Payroll system4. Hotel reservation system5. Hotel management system6. Online hotel reservation system7. Online billing system8. Online membership and billing system9. Online class scheduling system10. Online POS(Point of Sale)11. Online inventory system12. Online payroll system13. Online ordering system14. Online bidding system15. Voting system16. Online voting system17. Online shopping cart18. Medical records system19. Online public access catalog20. library system21. Record management system22. Supply inventory system23. E-learning system24. Social networking25. Hospital system26. E-voting system27. Video Library Management System35. Internet Cafe System36. Billing System37. Electronic Police Clearance System38. Salon System39. Human Resource Management System40. Pharmacy Automation System41. Order Billing Inventory SystemAll title above can be program using different programming language such as vb6, vb.net, php and etc. It's up to you guys what languages to use. I hope this post will help you to find best title for your thesis proposal.

Everything Equifax has done wrong and what lessons to learn from it. The Office of Personnel Management breach and what went wrong. Maybe cover the story of how it was accidentally discovered. The Awan brothers hacking the DNC from the inside and how the insider threat is the biggest threat, and you can parallel it to Wikileaks and Mr. Manning. You can also discuss solutions like the tools being implemented to try to prevent data leaks. Cloud computing moving from software as a service to infrastructure as a service and beyond. The technological development for the developing world like Youtube for India that runs on 2G networks and low grade “smart” phones. The Singularity as a religion, that there is no God but they want to invent an all knowing, all seeing, all powerful artificial intelligence to tell us all what to do and let us upload our minds to a digital paradise and gain immortality. And these are the biggest minds behind AI. The problems with putting our faith in computer models, whether financial models behind the 2008 economic collapse that said housing prices on average could not go down (read “The Big Short”) and climate models that say we can only go up in temperature and every variable multiples the effect though it doesn’t take a number of factors into account. The model is built based on the opinions of the creators and backed by various political agendas - but we assume since it is a computer generated model, it must be neutral.

why not something like "Programming via mash-up and intercommunicating portlets"? Let me explain: I think that inter-portlet communication can enable ICT people to build simple portlets dockable in a portlet container UI. These portlet can map one DB entity each, and include a pattern collection manageable by portlet configuration. a possible collection of these patterns can be: - form/table presentation and editability- separated communication channels for input and output- outputs automatically fed by getting focus on a specific record- read only/editable- business process portlets (wrapping a good business process engine to orchestrate the application behaviour) Of course I don't have to detail everything, what I say is just that building a set of separate portlets can allow to build "on the fly" all the user experience, and that could boost the productuvity and keep maintenance, analysis and design costs always under control. Refer to JSR-286 standard for reference of inter portlet communication

There are already so many good answers… An additional consideration is if your thesis is a master’s or a doctoral one. When you choose the topic try to sum up to the advancement of the culture and values that drive your life and not only solving an on style problem.

An examination of the role of advances in information technology in the elimination of information technology specialist jobs from the marketplace. Then write your thesis about how the more advanced the information system, the easier it is to use for non-specialists causing a reduced need for information technology specialists.

It depend what do you understand under the IT. You mean virtualization ? networks ? programming ? security ? AI ? quantum computing ? hacking ? cryptography ? gaming ? making processors ? … IT has so many branches. You should choose one and do whatever topic in the branch. From my point of view, thesis is there only to make you oriented in some specific piece/ branch of IT. You will learn what is important in your job.
